oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SAFETY PHILOSOPHY FOR DIKE DESIGN IN THE NETHERLANDS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Vrouwenvelder, A.W.C.M.
Struik, P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Netherlands
safety
dike
dike design
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper describes the history and present state of the art with respect to safety philosophy for flood defence systems in the Netherlands. It is explained that present day philosophy is based on a so called dike-ring approach and on a probabilistic treatment of all load and strength parameters. Both target safety levels as well as verification procedures are discussed. Simplification rules for application in every day practice are given.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 22 (1990): Proceedings of 22nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Delft, The Netherlands, 1990.
